Reviews.Title: 5 Stars. Here's why...
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: In considering what TV to buy my parents, I had the apparent choice between buying an led LCD or a plasma. I opted to get the led, but you wouldn't really be wrong to go the other route. My parents just wanted any TV that was bigger than 50 inches while I, being somewhat of a techy, needed to find the best TV over 50 inches. Well, here you have what I would call the third best TV over 50 inches (the 8500 and 8000 models being better) at the time of this review. This is the first of Samsung's new line of lcds to come out this year, and it narrowly beats out last years 6 and 7 series TVs by offering a better contrast ratio (4,000,000-1 vs. 3,000,000-1) for virtually the same price point. Otherwise, it's pretty much identical after reviewing the specs. Newer is better though in this case also because of the firmware upgrades and other fine improvements in engineering and technology.The TV was delivered about 5 days after I purchased it through Amazon, and it took about 15 minutes to set up. Out of the box the thing looks incredible. It's as thin as a blackberry! Some assembly was required with a phillips head and about 10 screws to attach the tv to the stand, but it was only 4 steps total and added to the suspense. After plugging in literally two cords (the hd component cables and the power cord) you are up and running. When the picture came on it was CRYSTAL clear. It puts every other TV I've seen to shame. You can go to Best Buy and do a side by side comparison and you won't find anything better. Forget about the plasma, this is the way to go. I could describe in more detail how great the picture is, but suffice to say it's flawless from movies to news to sports. Even if this is not your first HDTV, you will notice a big difference. I bought a 32" 240 mhz set in Decemeber and this tv is in another league. The LED side panel illumination works well, and there is very little adjustment of the settings necessary to achieve true to life picture quality."True to life" will be understood in a new way when you buy this TV. The longer it has been since your last TV purchase, the more breathtaking this advancement in technology will be. Regardless, this will be a TV that will have a useful life for years (longer than a plasma) and will always look amazing. That being said, I would get the warranty (2 years) for an extra 170 or so.Note: I chose lcd over plasma because lcds are noiseless and don't have the risk of picture burn-in. The 58' plasma I was looking at is the same price. This TV is better than plasmas priced less at the time of the review. If price is the main concern, I might do an in store side by side comparison with cheaper plasmas to see if the difference to you is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV, but may be too big for my room
Reviews.Author: M.L.
Reviews.Content: I went to a local electronics store to buy a 46" LCD to replace the Samsung 46" LCD I just broke and ended coming home with this. F ry s had it on sale for 1 5 0 0, so we decided to spend the extra 6 0 0 to buy this.  I was torn about not buying the Samsung TV with the Internet functions (Netflix, Pandora, etc..) but we have the PS3, which makes up for it.  We had to decide between the Samsung Models LN46C630, LN46C650, UN46C6300, UN46C6500, and this model UN55C6300. They were priced and 8 7 9, 1 0 3 9, 1 3 2 9, 1 4 9 9, and 1 4 9 9. We were only looking at Samsung because we have had only good experiences with Samsung until I accidently hit the LCD :(( (Crack!!)  Long story short we walked out with the 55"On to the Review:Before purchasing this TV, please consider your room size. We are about 10ft away from the TV and this is about as close as you want to be. There is a big difference between a 46" and 55"The setup was easy.  The size of the box makes it difficult for one person to carry it but the TV is light enough for one person to lift it.  The first step is to attach the back plate to the base with 5 screws, next it is suggested to use two people to put the TV on the base.  I was able to do this step by myself. It has tabs that latch in and 5 screws to attach the TV to the base.All 4 HDMI Ports are located on the side, so may need to use the cable management system that comes with the TV.  There is also a component video connection. There is no COMPOSITE video connector, which is a slight con for me because I need to buy a new connector for our WII. So if must have a composite connector on your TV then this TV is not for you. I did not dock the TV any stars for this because I could have looked closer... Besides composite to old school and I do not mind buying the component cableThe TV powers up fairly quick and noticeably faster than our 550 model I killed..The clarity of this TV is amazing, the colors really pop out and are well defined. It is almost like the people on the screen are in the room with you. I thought Blu Rays were unbelievable on our 46" LCD, it is trippy watching them on the 55" screen. Talk about seeing the pores on people's faces. Maybe it is a little too good of a picture :D (I know, no such thing) There is defintely some reflection from the TV but not enough to bother us.The sound is on par with our previous Samsung, which not great for audiophile people but more than enough then we need for our family.Because it is a LED LCD it is thin. It is a little over 1" thick.  Not as thin as the 9000 series but I do not have that kind of money laying around :)I highly recommend this TV for anyone with a room larger enough to accomidate it.  I am not having any buyers remorse. If anyone has any questions please post a comment and I will try to answer them.7/18/2010 Update - Just a quick 2 month update.  The TV continues to amaze and the Blu-Ray are just insane on this TV.  I see the electronics store has 6500 model for 200 more than we paid for this

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Island girl "island girl"
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for 2 months and it just doesn't seem like it could possibly be any better.  The colors are so true and there is so much depth that it actually seems 3D at times.  When you play a Blu Ray the colors pop even more and you really feel like you are part of the picture or scene.  I have done a double take at times because it appears so life like! We love this tv and are so happy when we get a chance to relax and watch it (not often enough!).  Wall hook up was a breeze and it has enough HDMI inputs to make it even easier.  I wouldn't recommend the Samsung Blu Ray player though if you are running everything thru a receiver. Samsung's "Any net" gets confused about what you are trying to do. Or at least the Universal remote doesn't recognize that the tv is in control of the Blu Ray player. (Or maybe it's me who gets confused on what it is trying to do!)  Anyway, I can't imagine any other tv delivering a better picture than this one.  You will enjoy it immensely!.

Reviews.Author: Brad Brockmeyer "RocknRolz"

} } } Length:: 0:39 MinsI bought the UN55C6300 and am extremely pleased with the picture quality. However right out of the box I noticed that the lips were not in sync, and also that the display was skipping frames very often.I have a DVD player, Blu-ray player, and a Satellite HD Receiver (Dish Network) All hooked up, and all sources have the same problems. I've tried the HDMI input, Coaxial, Component, and Composite inputs. All result in laggy video and out of sync audio.If I use the HDMI cable and the tv speakers, the audio is in sync. However with any external audio receiver it becomes evident right away that the video lags the audio by a lot (at least 120ms). Even if I turn "Game mode" on, the video still lags, just not as bad.Even if I upgrade to an audio receiver that has a delay function to try to sync the two, that would not help because the time between the audio and video delay seems to vary a lot. In other words, without changing anything, the audio and video will go closer to in sync and further from in sync throughout the day. This is a very frustrating problem. My BluRay Player has a built in delay function, but it maxes out at 120ms. When I have it at that setting, the lip sync problem is significantly improved, however the video STILL lags the audio very noticeably!The choppy video appears significantly when the "Auto motion plus" feature is enabled. The strange thing is that even if turn this setting on to "Custom" and turn both the blur reduction and the judder reduction to zero, it will still skip frames regularly. With the Auto Motion Plus turned off it will still skip frames, just very infrequently.The video I posted demonstrates the choppy video problem. You can see at the beginning of the video that the panning looks smooth. Then I turn on the "Auto Motion Plus" on the TV, and play the same exact segment again. This time you notice that the video looks much more clear during the panning, however it is extremely choppy. Every second it "Skips frames".Another strange thing about the choppy video problem is that the frequency of frame skipping changes with what show/movie is playing. For example, LOST in HD would skip frames every two seconds, driving us nuts and forcing us to shut off the "Auto Motion Plus". However Spiderman 3 on the same channel also in HD showed hardly any frame skipping at all. Blu-rays allowed me to have the auto motion plus setting on pretty high, but it would still randomly skip frames throughout each film.I know one of the responses I'm going to get will be just turn the auto motion off, but this setting does a spectacular job and was one of my main motivations for upgrading to a Samsung TV in the first place. Even with the frame skipping you can see that the picture is so much clearer during panning and overall, and it is such a shame to have to turn it off.The best way to describe what I am seeing is that it is like I am watching TV on my computer, and my computer's processor can't keep up, and therefore the video skips a bunch of frames every so often. This makes watching anything a lot less "fluid" and distracts me from getting "sucked in" to what I'm watching.I called Samsung and they said they've never heard of either of these problems. This gave me hope that I just have a bad TV. So they sent a technician out, and he replaced the processor and the power supply. No cigar, same exact problems after he leaves. So I exchanged the TV for another brand new one, take it home, and same exact problems. Looks like that's the way this TV is supposed to perform.Another thing that really irks me is that they combined the component and composite inputs. This means I have to choose one or the other two hook up; I don't get both. That means if I want to use my VCR, I have to disconnect the component input from my DVD or Blu-ray player.Between the audio and video always out of sync with my external speakers, and the fact that I can't use the "Auto Motion Plus" feature that looks so amazing but does not work properly, I am at a loss as to what to do. My wife is distracted by these issues, and shes not a picky person at all. Do I hang on to this and pray for a firmware update that will magically fix either or both of these problems, or do I take it back and try for another brand? I'm thinkin' its going back.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - no complaints
Reviews.Author: clarkKent
Reviews.Content: Like many others reading this review, I put a lot of research into which TV I was going to buy since I was paying so much. I upgraded from a 37" Sharp Aquos LCD. To sum it up, I am very satisfied with purchase and would buy again if I had enough money.Let me help ease some concerns that I found while I was researching this product.Flashlight/clouding:For the majority of people, you will probably not even notice this. I had read so many complaints about this that it nearly kept me from buying this TV. I had to research exactly what this issue was because at first I did not know what flash lighting or clouding was. Once I found out what I was looking for I checked my Sharp LCD to see if it had the same issues and occasionally it did. But the fact was I had the TV for 5 years and neither I or anyone else that ever saw the Sharp noticed it. The Samsung 55C300 does have a little flash lighting in corners but honestly I had to really "try" to find it and when Im not looking for it I dont even notice. While it may be an issue for some people, I believe for 90% of people looking to upgrade their TV, this is not an issue, and the fact is you will find complaints about flash lighting/clouding on almost every LCD/LED TV. Only a few TVs I came across had no complaints with this issue and those TVs were way out of my price range.Off-angle viewing:I think everyone knows that plasmas have the best off angle viewing and that LEDs are not great in this area. But for me it wasnt an issue because I have my TV set up in a place where off angle viewing will never be a issue and I have it on a swivel stand in case I need to turn it. So this wasnt an issue for me as it might be for some.Lag time:Lag time was another issue I read alot of people complaining about and since I play alot of xbox 360 and ps3 games this was almost a deal breaker. However Im happy to say I just dont notice any lag time, when I press a button it reacts instantly on the screen. I notice no difference between lag time in this TV and my old Sharp LCD. Maybe there are some video game "nerds"(some of which I can tell by watching their screens in Call of Duty), that to them things dont move fast enough, but those people dont have anything better to do then to complain about lag time so dont let them turn you off.Judder/frame skipping:I watched the video from the other poster that showed his cable program skipping frames on this TV. I have played blu ray, video games, live TV, and DVRed TV and so far I dont notice this frame skipping on anything. With or without Motion Plus turned on or off or used with different settings, its just not an issue.Glossy screen:I read some people complaining about the screen being so glossy that they couldnt even watch the TV. I dont know if these people are just easily distracted but its not that big an issue. You can see a glare in the TV if you look for it but when its on the picture is so bright and amazing that I dont even notice a glare. I even shined strong lights directly into the TV and I could still see the picture fine.Summary:You may come across many bad comments all over the web regarding this Samsung TV or other higher end models, but do not be afraid. Notice everwhere you find reviews, you will have maybe 1-5 bad comments but the other 90-95% are all positive reviews. Im not denying that some people have issues with the TV but I think for the majority of people, the issues are not that big of a deal. From the complaints I was reading I was expecting a unwatchable TV set that would lag, skip frames, have flash lighting that made tv unwatchable, and screen that acted as a mirror in reflecting light because of its "glossy" screen. That is the kind of TV you would expect after reading many of the reviews out there, but Im here to tell you most of it is overblown and for under $2000 you can expect a fine piece of equipment. If your looking for the "perfect" TV, I have read great reviews on the SamsungUNB8500, but have fun getting that for a decent price.PS: DONT SPEND MORE THAN $10 on HDMI cables

Reviews.Title: This is a Great TV, but not a Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Lopsided
Reviews.Content: This TV was an upgrade from my Samsung LNS4051D 40-Inch LCD HDTV. What bothered me most about my previous set was: a square "pixel" like movement during fast scenes (particularly moving water), poor gradients (obvious blocks when viewing graphic gradients - think PS3 wallpaper). Both issues have been eliminated with this upgrade and while my husband could not pick up on either I would not describe myself as a videofile, simply picky.Here are my opinions on:------GLOSSY SCREEN------I feared the high gloss screen would prove too reflective for me as I have a bay window on the side wall. Though I can easily see the reflections when looking for them it has not been a deal breaker for me for the same reason I prefer a gloss screen on my computer rather than a non-glare... the color representation, the depth, the clarity are all fantastic. The picture really is stunning.------ACCESSING THE INTERNET-----This model does not have independent internet access features. However, I access the internet and my computers media files thru networking with my PlayStation 3 250 GB so I felt paying more simply for an internet connection was senseless. That is available on Samsung UN55C6500 55-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV (Black) and the like thru Samsung Apps.------LACK OF 3D------I also could not convince myself to purchase a Samsung UN55C8000 55-Inch 1080p 240 Hz 3D LED HDTV merely for 3D TV. I have viewed it in the stores and while it has a cool factor it would not be long before I was sick of wearing glasses in my living room and felt motion sickness. To me at least, 3D is nice for a movie night but it simply won't tempt me to part with my money for the chance to say I have a 3D tv.-----WHY IT's NOT PERFECT------The one thing I don't like is the obvious brightness at the corners of the screen. This truly is the only negative I can find. This is only seen when the room and picture is very dark or the scene is displaying black in the corners. So, depending on the movie, you may not see this frequently enough to be readily aware of it. (My husband claims he can not see it.) This keeps the screen from being "seriously" black in dark scenes and that's a shame because the fantastic contrast ratio yields deep, dark blacks. This is a known issue/side effect with edge light LED technology used on Samsung TVs. In order to eliminate this I would have to move up from "edge lit" to their "local dimming" screen and for that shell out quite a bit more for the Samsung UN55C6800 55-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV (Black) or Samsung UN55C8000 55-Inch 1080p 240 Hz 3D LED HDTV, to name two. I realized this when I purchased the c6300 (which I got for $2K minus the $150 in certificates I had) and with the falling prices of technology I could not bring myself to spend even more for a TV, I also did not want to wait. If I felt it was a long term "investment" I would have spent the extra money, but I personally don't feel as though TV technology is long term in my house and certainly doesn't qualify as an investment due to the falling prices. :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV w/ the latest technology
Reviews.Author: John Villalovos "Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased and took delivery of this TV from Amazon and delivery was quick and efficient.  I had read just about all of the online reviews that I could find on this TV.  Since, it is so new, there aren't many.  The TV has a fantastic picture quality and it seems that some images and scenes look more "real" than standard LCD TV's.  Somehow, it often seems to have more depth and detail (almost 3-D'ish at times) than standard LCD screens with their standard CCFL back lighting.  I also felt that this Samsung's edge-lit LED panel had a superior picture to other brands of LED/LCD TV's.  Aware of possible chinks in the armor, I had read about the "blooming" or "flashlight" effect emanating from the corners of the screen when the screen is black, or showing dark scenes.  When I first set-up my TV and it was going through it's auto channel programming routine, the screen was all black and I did notice the slight blooming effect of faint cloudy light coming from the top two corners, for several inches.  However, it was not excessive, and was just discernible, and I have not yet noticed it when watching program material. Because the panel is so thin and the LED's are located on the edges and still have to carry light to other parts of the screen, with special diffusers, it is extremely difficult to completely suppress light "leakage" under all conditions with this type of back light configuration.  But, the reality is that, likely, these types of conditions constitute a very small percentage of one's total program viewing time and experience.  I have also noticed the occasional artifacting with some high speed movement, but, no more so than any other LCD TV, I've seen, even some at 240Hz.  I do like the frugal energy use that this 55" LED/LCD Samsung, has, along with it's super slim profile and sharp looks that are modern and updated, yet, understated.  However, the biggest factor that got me to pull the purchasing trigger, was the tremendous picture quality.  A beautiful bright screen, with sharp detail with high contrast and rich colors, that once set-up properly, looks super accurate and super real!

Reviews.Title: Solid picture quality and performance
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews talking about jittery output from a 1080p source, I was a little leery buying this TV but I am glad I did.  It did take almost 2 weeks to deliver through Amazon though and the tracking provided via CEVA was a little misleading.  That was the only part of the whole experience that could have used improvement.  I also purchased the Peerless SF670 low profile mount through Amazon.  The mount was already installed when the TV arrived so I mounted the brackets and the rear plate covering the stand hole on the back and the new TV was on the wall and hooked up in 10 minutes with one other person helping.  Although this TV is light enough for one to pick up, it is bulky and it would have been dangerous putting it up alone.The picture on this television is as advertised: great color, detail and refresh.  There is a setting for Auto Motion Plus that comes activated in Standard mode from the factory.  This is probably what caused other people so much trouble with the jittery performance.  This mode for me also caused studdering and jittery playback for 1080p content.  Setting this mode to Clear or turning it off alltogether clears up the problem.  The Auto Motion Plus feature is ONLY a gimmick and although it looks kind of neat in a trippy way, I could not imagine watching ANYTHING that way for any period of time, even if it didn't studder.  Some have talked about getting a firmware update to fix the jittering but I didn't even bother because I would rather watch movies the way they were intended to be be displayed, not in some surreal bizzare way.I am pushing 1080p from 2 sources... an XBMC media server running on an Aspire Revo with HDMI output and an HDMI HD cable reciever, all switched through an HDMI matrix switch with over 30 feet of HDMI cables.  The audio is tapped from a TOSLink fiber connector on the matrix switch and fed into an Onkyo DTS reciever.  Through all of this wiring, the picture has always been full 1080p and there is no delay in audio vs. video, even with the audio tapped upstream from the video. In my setup, I only run two cables to each TV, one HDMI and a return optical in case the audio ever was out of sync with the video - like I said though, no problems there so not really needed if you are using a HDMI switch with digital out.All in all, this TV was a very good value for my setup and I couldn't be happier with the purchase.  I have only had it a week though so have no comment about reliability.Update 4/25/13Even if this screen is not available anymore I do want to say that with editing projects and entertainment, it has been on at about 80% of the time since purchase.  I have had NO problems whatsoever with this display.  It is great and I have no complaints.  The current model is probably less reliable, while plugging you in more and offering less. If you get your hands on this model and turn off all of the gimmicks, it is a gem!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the light leakage and clouding
Reviews.Author: JSS "JSS"
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this TV are mostly positive but there are a handful of people who really have issues with edge lit LED technology and now I am one of them.  Even after calibrating the TV the flashlighting and clouding was unbearable (LED light leakage, especially in the corners).  I also experienced some issues with frames skipping now and then (I had a C panel not a SQ panel).  I returned this TV and picked up a UN55C6800 which also has edge lit LEDs but with precision dimming.  I tell you, this really makes a difference because all the issues I had with the UN55C6300 were resolved in the UN55C6800 - definitely worth the $350 premium.

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Windows Lover "DH"
Reviews.Content: The TV is simply awesome.  The contrast ratio is amazing.  Shortly after installing this TV, I helped setup a similar Samsung non-LED model (LN46C630).  The difference in contrast ratio was very noticeable to my now trained eye.I used the Samsung WMN1000B kit to mount it on the wall and it was simple to follow the instructions to mount it.  The quality of the parts in the kit was top-notch including everything that was needed except for the 1/2" drill bit that I had to purchase to drill through the wallboard and metal stud.  It is so slim to the wall that a neighboring framed painting actually sticks out more from the wall than this TV!I have noticed that a full dark gray picture (ie: black but not quite a complete black, as in the brief flash between a program and the 1st or last ad) exposes the only flaw I have seen.  When this occurs, you see a splotchy picture from uneven backlighting.  I believe that this is called flashlighting.  This is hardly a negative because I could care less what the picture looks like at that point.  If the TV detects pure black, it looks like the LED backlighting is actually turned off and appears black.The other downside is the viewing angle.  It works fine for us, but at some viewing angles the picture starts to wash out and the flashlighting is more noticeable from the corners of the screen.  However, if this is noticed, stepping to a narrower angle appears to resolve this appearance.  Again this is only noticeable if you are focusing on it, especially with a not-quite black image.

Reviews.Title: Great TV........maybe!
Reviews.Author: Judillia Kennedy
Reviews.Content: Unboxing and setting up the tv went quickly, only a few minutes to powering up.  At first, I thought it was going to work out wonderfully.  Many of the HD channels on Comcast's lineup were the same quality you would expect after seeing the store demo, absolutely beautiful.  The only problem was most of the channels I get looked crazy bad on it.  I expected the low resolution shows to not be up to par but to my surprise many of the HD channels were poor and some completely unwatchable.  I do not in any way think poorly of the TV, it performed well when it had the correct input.  I spoke with tech care and tried tweaking some settings, but no luck fixing it.  I think a smaller version of this tv in a spare room might perform better since the smaller screen size would hide any issues the service provided.  If you know your tv provider has great quality HD then I would recommend this tv without any hesitation, or if you were using it primarily for gaming.  I unfortunately had to send it back.  As far as Amazon goes, they were extremely easy to and their customer service was fantastic.  It shipped through Pilot Shipping and they were on time and quick on both trips.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Colors
Reviews.Author: Jason Hebert "TexasGolf"
Reviews.Content: Just had this 55" unit installed in my game room yesterday along with the 46" for my family room.I replaced a 61" samsung DLP that we had for a few years.  My first impression is the colors just pop off the set.  Wonderful contrast and true to life.  Also the price is amazing.  I have the tv in a room that has 3 tall windows and a set of french doors...the game room is on the west side of the house and gets full sun in the afternoon. The shutters help block the light, but the colors are so real and live in this set that it over powers any reflection or outside light.I researched tv's, like we all do, both online and in the stores for months.  Drove myself crazy....flip flopping back and forth between plasma and led.  The following tv's were considered: Panasonic plasma G and VT 54", Samsung plasma 58" 8000 series, and sony x810 55".bottom line is that I did not see much more in those sets to justify the price difference.Once you get the set home it is so much different than in the store compared to all the other sets that surround you tv.  I is just so unrealistic at the store.You cannot go wrong with the 6300Not sure on the sound quality...I have both sets hooked up to 5.1 surround sound.

Reviews.Title: Off-angle viewing is a bust
Reviews.Author: Fred K
Reviews.Content: Just received our UN55C6300 from Amazon.  Delivery was on time and as-scheduled, but quite a circus with all of the miscommunication from Pilot.  They called to confirm delivery, and explained how the drivers would bring set into the house, unpack, set-up and test.  Later the same day, Pilot called back to cancel delivery because TV hadn't been received on their end, and that they would call to reschedule once they had the TV.  Then, on the 'cancelled' delivery date (and without any prior notification), a Ryder truck pulls up out front and it's Pilot with the TV!  Driver and helper bring in the box and asked where we wanted the set.  I pointed to the TV stand, at which point they told me that they only place the box where the customer wants and don't do unpacking or set-up!  Quite a mix-up but we were happy that we happened to be home to accept the delivery.Anyway, onto the TV itself: it has a beautiful, vivid and crystal clear picture -- but only when viewed from head-on. The picture qulaity really suffers as your viewing angle moves towards the sides.  The colors begin to wash out starting at about a 30 degree viewing angle and get progressively worse as the angle increases to the point where the picture is downright horrible.  Searched the web and tried numerous calibration settings combinations (many can be found on the avsforum).  Some settings lessen the off-angle washout effect, but not to an acceptable level.  This is especially troublesome for our room layout, as we have an "L" shaped seating arrangement.  Having previously owned a plasma TV that was great for even extreme angle viewing, it looks like that's what we'll be shopping for after this one gets returned.

Reviews.Title: I love, love, love this TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Mornes "movie and book lover"
Reviews.Content: I researched LED TVs for weeks before deciding upon this model last July.  It is absolutely fabulous.  Thanks for all of the past reviews which helped me to decide on this one.The picture is flawless.  Others have complained about the lack of synchronization.  That's because your listening through something other than the TV speakers.  Use the TV speakers and there's no problem.DH attached a cable so that we can watch media from an SD card (or other direct input) and be able to use the wireless headphones!We've had other family members complain that the picture is TOO GOOD!This is only my second Amazon review, but I feel so strongly that I had to pass the word about this wonderful TV.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: corona91719
Reviews.Content: It came down to the Panasonic G20 or this. Wasn't too sure about the loss of black levels on the Panasonic so I decided to go with the Samsung. Very clean and understated design. The picture quality is very nice. Hooked up my new Oppo BDP-83 and WOW!!!! Watched Avatar and Transformers and both looked great. Noticed some, what I believe people call, "Flash-lighting" at the bottom corners with letter-boxed movies. Sound is fine for now as I have yet to hook it up to my 5.1 system. Only concern will be reliability. For that I will have to wait and see. For now, I recommend this product!!!Update - Flashlight, spotlight issue is a lot worse! Made an appointment to have service done so we will see if they can fix it. If not, regret the purchase. If I had to do it all over again I would probably go with the Panasonic plasma.

Reviews.Title: very good picture
Reviews.Author: amt
Reviews.Content: When come to TV I have never purchased any brand other than SONY. I tried SAMSUNG this time and to my surprise the picture is sharp, the color is vibrant. The reason I give 4 stars because I think there is always room for improvement. The service from Amazon is good and you have 30 days return and Amazon will pick it up from your home if you decide to return. Well I think I'll keep it because the price is lower than COSTCO and picture quality is awesome. I have had for 3 weeks.amt

Reviews.Title: Samsung does well with the C6300, but beware of red shadows
Reviews.Author: 8800 User
Reviews.Content: We've been trying to replace a dead Sony rear projection for the past month.  We originally started off with a Sony LED TV (EX700) but found that it had such a narrow viewing angle that we decided to return it.  After heavy research we landed on the Samsung UN55C6300 but even this TV had issues.Pros of the Samsung:The Samsung has a much better viewing angle than the Sony did. In fact, I believe that the only better viewing angle would be the LG 5400 or 5500 series or better.  Remember, however, that even for a Samsung the viewing angle is quite narrow (like ~30 degrees off center).  The TV is super thing (1.1") from top to bottom. If you plan to hang it on the wall this will make it look real nice.  The remote is backlit, allowing for dark room viewing.  There are many, many user settings that can be adjusted - almost too many - which I like since I like to be in control of the TV and it's settings. Fast channel switching - while watching digital channels you can blast through them very quickly unlike the sony which took about 1 second for each channel change.Cons of the Samsung UN55C6300:Outside the viewing angle (30 degrees or more) and colors fade and get washed out and the reds tend to over-saturate making the picture unwatchable (or untolerable). I expect the PQ to degrade on wider angles however, on the Samsung it was the over saturation of some colors that I had an issue with. On our Sony, the colors would washout but the TV was still tolerable and extreme angles. Not this Samsung, unless you like a lot of red.  Gloss screen isn't that bad however, reflections of lights and bright spots behind you will cause "rainbows" on the screen which will be visible in dark scenes and can be distracting.  Auto volume normalization is implemented in a horrible, non-functional manner. If you enable the auto volume normalization (under sound settings) then be ready for erratic sound volume changes. For example, if a scene became loud the TV would auto-adjust the volume down but would do it so drastically and in one step that it would be immediately obvious and noticeable.  Then, if the scene got quiet and there were voices, you could not hear them until the TV adjusted the volume back up. Auto dimming (auto brightness) is a "feature" that cannot be disabled. You can turn off the backlight auto-dimming under "Eco" settings, however even with these settings off the TV will still make adjustments to the brightness. This can be distracting at times although most times it's not noticeable. The TV remote has too many buttons.  I like controls, but the remote has so many buttons I felt I had to study it every time I wanted to do something.  Out of the box colors were horrible. Samsung tends to over-saturate their colors so what may look great at Best Buy will NOT look so great at home - under normal viewing conditions. I spent hours trying to tune the colors so that they looked right. Connecting to a PC (or HTPC running windows media center) was a real pain.  Unlike the Sony that "just worked," the samsung I had to go online and read about proper settings for PC connections (not as simple as connecting the HDMI cable). Black levels and color schemes (studio vs pc), screen fit, etc, were all now factors I had to learn and understand in order to make the proper TV settings so that MCE would look OK.  Samsungs implementation of the "Auto Motion Plus" is overdone compared to others causing severe "Soap opera effect" in nearly every show, luckily this can be easily disabled or adjusted down. Light bleeding from corners - in both Samsung sets we had noticeable light bleeding from the bottom two corners.  The light was noticeable on black/dark scenes and at first was distracting until we got used to it.After two weeks of owning this TV we decided that we would live with it's shortcomings.  Some of the annoyances were tolerable and others could be turned off in the settings.  However, we started to notice a major problem with the TV which began to catch our attention every time we were watching a show.  This problem is red tracing, or red shadows.  We noticed that in scenes that contained reds or browns (ie: brown hair or clothing) that a character would have a red shadow on their face or a red trace or outline around their body or head during movement or panning.  It became way distracting.  We called the retailer who sent a Samsung certified tech out to our house. Within 10 minutes he determined that the TV was defective and needed a part. Being on our last return day we opted to return the TV instead. Our replacement Samsung had the identical issue - red tracing and red shadows.  So I immediately packed up the new Samsung and returned it, this time opting for a Sony KDL52NX800.  Out of the box the Sony just worked in so many ways (better color, easier setup).  Admittedly so the Samsung does have a slightly better picture than the Sony (when it's tuned right and doesn't have red tracing) and a slightly better viewing angle, but we're sticking with the Sony now.In general I believe the Samsung to be a decent TV but you should know what you're going into. The picture on it is amazing, especially from a blu ray, once it's tuned right. If you're a videophile then this TV may work for you since you'll be OK with all of the adjustments, but if you want something that just works then look at Sony or Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Wowsers
Reviews.Author: Lowell
Reviews.Content: There is no other TV to even look at.  LG, worthless, anything that looks like a TV and has the Sony name on it; Worthless.  If you are looking for a TV that is non-3d (which it is too early to look at 3d yet, need to see how that plays out over next 2 years), 50-55", then this is the only unit to look at.  On black Friday I picked it up for 1499 with no tax or shipping.  This unit has the brightest colors, sharpest colors and cleanest lines.  Heck even the audio is decent.  Only wish is that they had thrown the internet TV feature into this 6300 series.  Otherwise YOU need to buy this one.  If you have an extra $1200 then do the 60" 6400 series model.  Otherwise this unit is huge over my fireplace and will lighten up the coming holiday gatherings like no other.  Purchase and enjoy.Also got the Samsung sound bar with sub and its unstoppable.  No wiring rears anymore, its the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon frequent buyer
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but this TV has the best picture quality I've ever seen!  The viewing angle is not an issue at all and I love that it's energy efficient and light weight.  We have a 1 yr old 55" LCD to compare it to and the LED picture is so much more clear.  We are so happy with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't disappoint...
Reviews.Author: A. Friedlander
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture quality, images pop out.  Light enough for me to mount on the wall by myself.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Great picture and easy to assemable. Easier with 2 people but manageable with one. Easy connections and set up. All in all a great buy at the time.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. Schmitt "grandaddym"
Reviews.Content: Great TV. I've had this tv for a month and it has been a pleasure to watch. I will investigate the other atributes in the near future. I definitely recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: excellent if you know what you are looking for
Reviews.Author: J. Rawat "rawjazz"
Reviews.Content: So far its been a week since I have been using this HDTVI have been enjoying it as I got a sweet deal on Thanksgiving (1499), let me tell you I wasted loads of hrs researching about HDTVs, LED Vs LCD Vs Plasma, 2d vs 3d etc, as this was my first time.  By the end of selection I was 100% sure about this TV.  If you do so there are less chances of regretting later on.  Reason is this TV does not include internet apps, no wireless, its a 2d TV only, it has 4m contrast ratio as compared to 5m but I really didnt want to invest on all those, I just needed a 55" LED which would work the way it described, internet apps is not a big deal at all these days as you get fully loaded bluray players, wireless is waste for me as I would use a 55" TV for only watching movies or serials not as a computer monitor (Netflix connection is lousy with wireless, even if you have a fast internet), 3d tv is a big hype as of now (money vs performance tradeoff), i have seen and tried 3d numerous times and i feel they have lots of work to do, moreover i did not want to spend tonnes of money on glasses for no reason.  4m to 5m contrast ratio, 120hz to 240 hz is unnoticeable for normal human beings with naked eyes, so why pay etc.  Last but not the least if I am getting a sweet deal why not buy it on thanksgiving day, [...]Enjoy and good luck in your hunt

Reviews.Title: Great LED backlit TV!
Reviews.Author: S. Maji "puzzler"
Reviews.Content: I generally do not write reviews. But this tv amazed me so much I am forced to write one. I bought this tv from a brick'n' morter store for an unbelievable price. Right out of the box, the picture quality was excellent. Even the non-HD channels were near HD quality. When I hooked up the hd comcast cable box, I was just WOWed! Truly amazing color accuracy. I watched Life and Planet Earth. Every frame looked like a picture taken by $2000 DSLR camera.I know people have been complaining about corner flashlights. I know that LG tvs dont have that (as they are backlit), but I was stumped the Samsung picture quality. It was unreal! And the contrast enhancing clear coating totally works for me. I know you could see your own reflection when the unit is off. But when its on, you cant see anything but great pictures. About the corner flashlights, Yes, its there. But nothing to distract your from anything. Also if you are watching from the dead center position you wont even notice it.Pros: Excellent picture quality, color accuracy.  Very deep blacks.Cons: Poor off angle contrast + some corner flashlights.Go ahead and buy it. You wont regret.

Reviews.Title: Faulty product, extremely poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Samsuck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon about 2 years ago.  At first, I would have given it 5 stars.  It's picture is second to none.  The only issue I noticed at first was hooking up external speakers the sound seemed to have problem syncing with peoples lips.  The TV's speaker sounds great on it's own, so I didn't have a problem just using that.After about a year and a half of owning this TV, it would shut off and turn right back on, on it's own.  It continued to get worse as time went on and one evening, the TV was comletely dead, wouldn't turn on at all.  I called Samsung and blah blah blah, my TV is out of warranty.  Fine... I paid for the power supply board to be replaced out of my own pocket.  The repair guy was great (he doesn't work for Samsung).A few days later the TV shut off again and was back to it's old tricks.  Apparently it wasn't the power supply board.  I put up with it for a while, but it's to the point it's turning off 20+ times per night.I've tried everything, different coax cables, HDMI cables.  I even returned my Comcast box and got a new one.  So I called Samsung and was transfered to the escalated service center.  I explained my problem and was on hold for a while.  When they got back to me, they said they would help me out by scheduling me an out of warranty repair... Thanks for nothing.  This is a known problem with Samsungs and they won't own up to it.  I've already spent $200 in repairs and I'm not about to spend $300 for a new mother board.  I will NEVER buy a Samsung product again.  I'm more frustrated after talking to their customer service department than I was with my TV turning off.I'd rather go out and buy a new LG than sink any more money into this lemon Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great quality, unbeatable price.
Reviews.Author: GratefulDaughter
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this TV! I had seen a sale ad with Best Buy.  I called right away, the day of the sale and they were discontinued. Couldn't find them anywhere.  Then I looked for the TV but LCD, same size, couldn't find them any more! I saw several of them online and Amazon had the best price.  It was cheaper than the 'sale' price at the other stores and the quality is superb! My mom is very happy.  I love how when you turn on the Samsung BluRay Player, the TV automatically switches to that source... I would definitely recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv, awesome picture.
Reviews.Author: william patelis
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome, i got it as a Christmas present for my family and we all love it. I have never seen a picture so clear before in my life. Movies look like homemade video and you feel like you are there with the cast. This is one of the top of the line TV's out there right now. I did a lot of research before i bought this and you cant beat the price or the TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Television
Reviews.Author: Christopher Houck
Reviews.Content: I've had this for several months now, works great picture is crystal clear. The onboard sound isn't loud enough for me which doesn't really matter to me because I have a surround sound system which I use. My only other complaint is that the black plastic it's encased in is a dust magnet and because it's so glossy the dust is easily noticable. I find myself cleaning mine every few days.

Reviews.Title: very good TV
Reviews.Author: drpeds
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD TV, so it's a huge upgrade. It has a great picture and it's extremely thin, with a very good viewing angles. The sound quality is not the best, but it's pretty good given the extreme thinness of the TV. I'm planning to get a home theater system to improve the sound. While you can connect it to the internet directly so that it upgrades its own software, it does not stream video independently. you need a device to connect to the TV to stream video from the internet. otherwise, it's a pretty awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC TV at the price
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV for the price.  Yes, it does have its flaws (ghosting, shadowing coming in from the sides, edge blurring at close viewing, SD picture quality), BUT for the price it is hard to beat.  I notice these "flaws" because I am an AV geek who likes his equipment and does countless comparisons.  Everyone else who has seen this TV in HD not only does not notice the flaws I mentioned, but they are so blown away by the picture that they want to go out and get one themseleves.  Again, you can certainly find TVs with a better picture/performance, but at this price point this is one hell of a picture and deal!

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, but lots of glare!
Reviews.Author: Linzrob
Reviews.Content: First I'll say we were not impressed with the shipping method used.  We were tracking the shipment and the TV was delivered to the local shipment house for DAYS before anyone contacted us to set up delivery.  When they finally did, they gave us a 3 hour delivery window but showed up an hour later than the scheduled window time.  That being said, it was just after Thanksgiving and we knew they were probably very busy.  The picture on this TV is amazing and great quality, but we were disappointed in the amount of glare with the screen.  We set the TV up just before Christmas and, b/c of the position of our Christmas tree, we had to watch the reflection of the tree lights along with our favorite TV shows.  The look of the TV and the picture quality are fantastic, but I kind of wish I'd paid attention to similar reviews warning of the glare and considered the LG.  Also, when you first connect the TV, it is on an auto setting which makes the programs look like a "live" taping (that's the only way I know to describe it...like every program looked like it was filmed just like SNL)...it makes you very aware that the actors are ACTORS on a SET and it was very distracting...we did NOT like that at all.  We were so relieved when we realized it was a setting we could change and return to the "normal" look we were used to.  Once we got that figured out, we have been pleased...especially when the tree came down and the light reflections were minimized.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, but....
Reviews.Author: S. Gooding
Reviews.Content: Received the TV on time and in perfect condition. Out of the box it took mere minutes to mount on the stand and set viewing preferences, this was easier because I bought this TV to replace an older problematic Samsung DLP TV, so I'm familiar with the Samsung menu format and user interface. This TV is so much of a visual improvement over my old DLP that I can only describe the picture ( especially for 1080p HD sources) as georgeous. So for that purpose this TV met all my expectations.The few points I would mention to potential buyers of this TV are, before you buy consider all that you will want from this TV. I live in the Caribbean and therefore we do not have access to many of the online services like "Hulu" for example, so the Internet and widget management and access were less of a necessity for me. If this feature is important to you, then there are other TV's in this price range that offer both built in wifi (this TV requires a separate proprietary dongle) and similar visual performance.The TV design is a bit of a personal style issue and yes I did find the screen to be a bit reflective but when the TV is on this is less of an issue and that is when it really matters, isn't it? The stand design, slight forward lean and "nervous" screen flex when mounted do not scream "stability" but coming from a large base DLP TV that could just be me.The "home movie HD camera" look to programs does take some getting used to as it is a departure for most from the warmer softer feel of  480i/p and 720i/p programming but in this case "change is good", as I will gladly get used to it in exchange for the additional clarity and detail that you gain.Have only has the TV for a week, but so far have watched quite a few Blu-Ray movies and a fair amount of programming through my local digital cable provider and I am very pleased so far, if this changes due to issues that arise ( which I hope there won't be) I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: Help regarding gaming on this tv.
Reviews.Author: Skygazer629
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for several months and experience problems when gaming with the screen seeming to lag.  For certain games, simply adjusting the tv to game mode fixes the problem.  More time sensitive games like Call of Duty and other first person shooters however are unplayable.  Basically I target someone, press the button to fire, and dont hit them because the image I see rendered seems lagged by about 1/4 of a second.  Any replies would be appreciated.On another note the tv is beautiful and I would highly recommend it for anyone not concerned with gaming on it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Television
Reviews.Author: xsandman
Reviews.Content: I used to have a 1080i DLP TV that I thought had a great picture, the reason I got a new TV was because it was a house warming present.  As soon as I plugged it in and turned it on, I was completely shocked how much better it was that my DLP TV.  The picture quality is amazing, as well as the contrast.  I don't feel like I am watching TV anymore, it feels like I am watching my neighbor through a window.  You feel every movement of the characters, like you are right there in a scene.  I couldn't beleive how much of an difference it makes.I have seen many reviews about the speakers being horrible, and you can barely hear it (being such a thin TV), and i was expecting to have to get a nice surround sound system to go with it.  The speakers are pretty good, and get very loud.  I will still get a surround sound system, but no need to get one immediately as expected.  I could even get away without one if I wanted.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Christina Anderson
Reviews.Content: I just purchased my Samsung 55" LED 6300, and i have to say this tv has exceeded all of my expectations. The picture is outstanding, the 120hz motion pro is soooooo cool, it makes everything move so smoothly, the slim design is amazing, i never thought technology would get this advanced, i cant wait to get another one for my loft. I would deffinetley recommend this tv to anyone who is looking, you cant go wrong with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: How I picked this model
Reviews.Author: chris_nwb
Reviews.Content: LCD or LED - Comparing floor models in a brick & mortar store, LED (technically, LED backlit LCD) beats LCD hands down. I haven't purchased a TV in a looong time, so why not spoil myself with "newer" technology. As for picture quality between LED TVs, I couldn't discern the difference between 4M:1 contrast ratio of this model and >6M:1 of the higher models.3D or non-3D - 3D TVs are the "latest" out there, but I don't see the value of paying extra $$ to watch a handful of 3D Blu-ray titles.46" or 55" - I'm viewing the TV from 8 ft. away and the 55" looks fantastic!Internet@TV or not - the next models up, C6500 and C6800, have this feature and C6300 does not, but I purchased this TV with the Samsung HT-C6900W blu-ray + home theater system which supports it. No need to pay for this feature twice. Besides, Samsung's TVs require a separate "LinkStick LAN adapter" accessory for WiFi, and the HT-C6900W has it built-in.The UN55C6300 got the most bang for my buck. I picked the right choice--this TV is really worth it!

Reviews.Title: Sam-LED TV
Reviews.Author: RB "Roy"
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the performance of this TV. It's been in service for about three months and we have yet to find a problem with the set. The wifi connection was easy to set up and works well. If your looking to upgrade from a tube, plasma or LCD you can't go wrong with the LED. By now all of our friends and neighbors have seen a movie or show on the set and still comment about the picture quality and performance.

Reviews.Title: Backlight Problems & Poor Viewing Angle
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The slim form factor is great and the picture is pretty good.  It is also easy to use.  However, when the picture has dark scenes or the side bars are active (non HD), you can see that there are some serious backlight issues with this LED LCD.  It looks like there are clouds on the screen and the corners look like there are flashlights shining out of them.  Especially bad in darker room or at night.  You will not see this in the store.  I tried every adjustment possible and the only thing that helped was turning the backlight way down, but that kind of defeats the purpose of a LED backlit LCD.  I returned it and tried another one and same thing.  The side viewing angle is terrible on this TV. When you move more than 10 or 15 degrees to the side the picture washes out.  Not acceptable for viewing within the same room and if you like to go from the family room to the kitchen and still see the picture, this LCD will not work for you at all.  Returned it and purchased Sony LED LCD and could not be happier.  I guess Sony has figured out how to overcome these issues.  Love the Sony.  I would recommend Sony over the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: The lone drawback for me is reflectivity
Reviews.Author: J. Thompson "jimmy"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  This is the 55" 2010 model, least expensive of the 120 Hz 55" LED LCDs Samsung UN55C6300 55-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV (Black) from Samsung.  Very good picture with crisp, rich, brilliant colors and good blacks.  I watch mostly golf; this is clearly an upgrade from my 4 year old DLP Samsung, which was already excellent.  The picture is easily bright enough for full daylight viewing.  No LED side-lighting issues.  No blur watching basketball.  Thin 1" panel.  This TV is much slicker than the typical 3 or 4" thick ones.  There are recesses for all connections such that they come out sideways within the pocket (parallel to the plane of the panel) and with Samsung hardware you can hang it very close to flat against the wall, like a picture. Viewing angle is terrific, even from way off to one side.  It is very light; only about 45 pounds with stand.  The VESA mount screws are 480x480 if you use a third party wall mount.  The included stand is quite nice.  The bezel is pretty thin; about 1 1/2" wide on the sides and top; 2" at the bottom.  Overall height dimension was actually less than my 50" prior model.Cons:  Despite the Samsung marketing line, this panel is quite reflective--more on par with a typical plasma than an LCD.  It's much more reflective than a similar LED thin-panel LG model.  This does not bother some people; their eye seems to focus on the plane of the TV and they don't even notice it.  For others it's like looking in a mirror.  If reflectivity bothers you, don't buy this TV unless you can angle it away from bright sources such as lights and windows.  This is what we did, and as a consequence, even though it's in a room with big windows, the angle is such that none of the windows or overhead lights reflect back to the viewer.  You will notice the reflectivity particularly when the picture has a large area of uniform dark color such as blue or black.  I might add that the bezel itself is reflective, which annoys me.  For some reason manufacturers seem to like that.Since I bought the TV knowing how reflective it is and knowing I could set it up to avoid reflections, I'm not disappointed in any way, and give it five stars.  Delivery from Amazon was 48 hours from order entry.  I paid $2100 delivered to my door but would not be surprised if it could be found for less elsewhere.  If cost is an issue and thinness or weight is not, I suspect you'd get the same or similar picture from a less expensive plasma TV.  However I am rating this TV on its own merits and not necessarily on the most bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Had same problem others have noted
Reviews.Author: J. Cassella
Reviews.Content: Just thought I should let potential buyers know that I had the same skipping problem noted others.  In fact this problem seems fairly wide spread if one does a Google search.  Picture quality was very good but I had hard skips with Blue Rays and terrible streaming performance.  Tried many adjustments, contacted customer service and tried downloading the firmware update, which is supposed to fix streaming issues (which I could not get the TV to recognize).  Finally gave up and sent the TV back.  Bought a new Panasonic VT25 series plasma and couldn't be happier.  The new set is a lot more expensive, but it does work - making it a TV to be used not an ongoing project.The only thing more annoying then the TV was the company telling me they were unaware of the problem.  I recommended they do a Google search.  Or better yet, read comments by customers on their own website.So if you buy this TV don't throw out the box.  It may work great for you, as some have indicated.  But it seems there's a good chance it won't.I do not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Not very happy with the TV for over the air HD
Reviews.Author: Ashish Gupta
Reviews.Content: We have a standard definition receiver from Dish network and use over the air antenna for HD Channels. Over the air HD channels from the antenna would result in TV becoming unresponsive, if the digital signal was weak - the TV would create a picture with small broken squares when the signal was weak - and eventually the screen would go black. Trying to navigate through the channels would not work any more until the TV was restarted.The channel navigation was very slow - about 12 seconds lag when moving from one channel to the next.The Standard Definition picture from our Dish network receiver was of very poor quality with shadows of images all over. One would say this would be expected when connecting a HD TV to Standard Definition, however our LG LX6500 3D TV does a much better job of displaying the Standard definition with no shadow at all.Overall, this TV is not the best option if you plan to view over the air HD Channels. This would be a very small population of people - so should not matter for samsung. I don't have much feedback on how the TV would work with High Definition receivers or Blu Ray players - so don't get biased reading this review with the purchase if you plan to use the TV with HD receiver or Blu Ray players. Read other reviews in to get feedback on these scenarios.

Reviews.Title: Strange Complaint
Reviews.Author: R. Goble
Reviews.Content: Okay first off this is going to be the strangest review I have ever done.  First the picture quality is beyond belief.  It is simply fantastic.  I don't even know how to start this review off.  But here it goes.  Because the picture is so good when you watch TV it looks live, like you are right there.  Now how can this be a bad thing?  I am not a technical hound but trying to explain this is very hard.  It is the difference between watching day time soap opera and night time programming.  The clarity is so good that everything you watch seems like you are watching a day time soap.  Or some really cheesy adult film off of HBO.  So, when you are watching a movie that looks like that brings to mind that "bad" quality, when in fact this is excellent quality that makes the movies look cheesy.All I can say is before you buy this TV ask them to let you watch a normal movie, whether it is BluRay or a DVD it doesn't matter, check out the quality and see if you like watching all your programming in day time soap style.  It truly is bizarre at best and I honestly can't tell if I like it.  I like the quality and how clear the picture is but I don't like the cheesy feel of live/soap/adult movie style.  I am so on the fence.My family and I watched Toy Store 3 on it and I was just dumbfounded on the quality.  It was so good I was in awe most of it just watching the fine details you can't normally see.  Like the texture of Mr. Potato head and the plastic look of dolls.  Truly amazing.I have only had the TV for a week now and I am very impressed with the quality. I bought the Samsung 3D BluRay player with it and love the fact they are integrated.  I tell the TV to switch to BluRay and it turns on the BluRay player.  Very nice!I probably confused everyone with this review but I want to ensure that you watch a normal movie/cable instead of the feed the store gives you.  Then you decide if you like the "live" look of the movie.  Also, it does it to your favorite TV shows.  I love Two and half men, and when I watched it, it looked like live performers on a stage.  I can't really explain it but it just looks very strange.  I am sure I will get used to it.I read people compaining about glare.  I have this TV located in a room that has floor to ceiling windows the entire length of my living room (25 feet) and I do not have a problem with it.  I thought I would but it hasn't been an issue.

Reviews.Title: Even better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Steven M. Anderson
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced a 5-year-old Pioneer 43" Plasma.  I was going for a larger screen and lower power consumption.  What I did not expect was a superior picture.  It is a noticeable improvement over the Pioneer (that cost 3 times the price of this Samsung).  An awesome picture.Use caution when unpacking - I cracked the plastic frame that surrounds the screen during unboxing.- Pros: amazing picture, very light for its size, clean connections in back, very nice on-screen settings control, a handy tone sounds on power on or off, attractive frame, consumes only 93 watts.- Cons: Fragile stand and plastic frame.Overall rating: highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: An NFL Fan
Reviews.Content: Price was fabulous in comparison to local stores. Delivery date was accurate.  Picture quality is outstanding and set up with the directions was quite easy.  Samsung quality superior to other brands.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase.
Reviews.Author: The Captain
Reviews.Content: The picture is good,but could be a little more sharper. Also cloulding appears on some dark scenes.

Reviews.Title: This TV is everything we expected!
Reviews.Author: greatvet1 "greatvet1"
Reviews.Content: The shipping was a little slower than I expected, but it was packaged well and arrived in perfect condition.  This TV is so incredibly thin!  My wallet is thicker than the TV.  The picture is incredible!  It's clear, bright, and has very high definition.  While waiting for direct TV to be hooked up, we tuned in to the local channels and the picture was still great, but once the direct TV went in, OMIGOD!!!  It seems like the characters on the high def channels are in our living room!  We have a 26" Samsung flat screen HD LCD TV we bought several years ago and have always loved it, so it was a no-brainer for us to go with Samsung again.  Not to mention that when we looked at all of the different brands in the store, the Samsungs appeared to have much nicer pictures.  We were surprised at how much thinner the TV's have gotten just in the few years since our last purchase.  I would highly recommend this television to anyone considering a new addition to their home.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: AL Law
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for two years and have no complaints. I think Samsung has the best picture for the money.  (Sony is as good or maybe better but at a higher price).  This TV looks great, has an excellent picture, is reasonably priced (at least when I bought it), and is generally a good deal in my opinion.  HD channels are really sharp on this TV.  There was a touch of blur at first with fast sports (i.e., a thrown football in flight), but I found a setting that totally fixed that.  I would buy again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Love LED technology
Reviews.Author: Jewle
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for over 3 years now & it still looks & works great. The colors are still brite.  Love the sleek clean style of the frame & standReally am happy there are a lot of ports on the back. So far just enuf for my needs. Neat feature that I can plug my phone line into it as well & have caller ID display on the tv screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Television!!
Reviews.Author: mommyfutch
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it has been 2 1/2 years since I bought this TV.  Honestly, at first I didn't like it because the screen was soooo... crisp and clear.  It was something I wasn't used to on my old television... it has grown on me though!  Screen size is perfect for a large room and has plenty of ports for setting up components.  Love HDMI capabilities as well!  The only regret I have ever had is that we didn't get a 'smart tv' although we have never been in a situation where I was like "oh... but if I had a smart tv, I COULD do this"... I just think it would be kind of neat to have maybe?

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Corvus + Snow
Reviews.Content: We love out TV. We've had it for more than two years now. It's amazing, and I can't think of anything negative to say besides the power cord being slightly easy to pull out.Seriously, you can plug a USB into the side and play music and videos straight? WHAAAAT? Incredible.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product - lots of ports, great picture
Reviews.Author: techie
Reviews.Content: This TV has tons of connection ports so you can plug in a variety of devices and the picture quality is great.  The speakers are quite good for being built into the TV and overall I think it's a great value.  The problem is Samsung support sucks- I need some replacement screws because I bought this as a used mint condition product and the screws for the base were missing.  They sent me the wrong item twice before finally getting it right and it took about 2 weeks each time.  So don't count on Samsung support, if you need screws or other parts just go to the local hardware store instead... and hope they carry them.. I had to search pretty hard to find the ones that would fit.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture, except for the dead pixels after 22 months!
Reviews.Author: Nathan C. Gough "cybernate777"
Reviews.Content: When we first got this TV, it was by far the BEST TV I have ever owned, with the BEST picture quality I have ever seen!  I was now sold on SAMSUNG, and even bought a 40 inch for my bedroom a year later.  Now we are 22 months into owning this beautiful 55 inch LED, and there are 3 bright white dead pixels on the screen in seperate areas.  I called SAMSUNG, and a very polite woman said "Sorry, the warrantee only covers 12 months, we can schedule an authorized repair center to come out a let you know how much it is going to cost to get this issue repaired, or you could try and live with the issue."  I informed her that I will simply live with the issue, as I have spent well over $1000.00 on this TV when I purchased it 22 months ago, and shouldn't have to spend more to keep it running, but thank you anyway.  I don't particularly place all the blame on SAMSUNG, as almost ALL TV manufacturers only give you a 1 year warranty.  This is another one of those "lightbulb" moments for me that I just got ripped off yet again by my own consumerism to spend this much money on something that won't be covered if anything happens after only 12 months.  I basically spend about $100.00 a month just for the privilege of watching a TV without any problems, but once the warranty expired, BAM, reality hits.  BTW, if this dead pixel problem never happened, and/or SAMSUNG stood by there TV and went ahead and repaired/replaced it, this review would have 5 stars.  GOD BLESS!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Poor Sound
Reviews.Author: Garobelka
Reviews.Content: The picture quality with my HD programming is flawless, but the sound quality is poor, the speakers make annoying noise even when the volume is less than half way. Also the processor for internet access is pretty slow. I have an apple TV as well, works much faster.

Reviews.Title: colorful & clear.
Reviews.Author: Letty
Reviews.Content: Purchased this tv over a year ago and it's still working great!Now I just hope I haven't jinxed myself.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture, Excellent Television
Reviews.Author: Vampyre Mike
Reviews.Content: I was getting rid of an old Mitsubishi Projection, LED seemed to be the rage at this point so I did some homework and purchased this T.V.First off the picture is beautiful, the viewing angle could be better but is decent. The vast amount of tweaking and options for this set is great, you can brighten, darken, change all kinds of things in between. It also has BD-Wise which lets it speak to other Samsung devices (Blu-Ray players, etc..) and pick the best picture quality.Some people complain about the Auto-Motion Plus feature, but I think it's amazing. When the setting is enabled it makes the visuals look filmed with a home video camera/soap opera, almost too smooth. It will take some getting used to but is ideal for new Blu-Rays and great fast moving action films. It smooths every motion on screen and sometimes people don't like the effect because it looks too smooth and takes away from the movies intended blurs. I disagree, but to each their own. And the setting can always be turned on/off or even tweaked for some but not full force.My only small gripes with the T.V. are the viewing angle could be a bit better, and the sound is OK but not great. I eventually broke down and bought a sound bar and wireless sub 2.1 just to hear the voices better in Blu-Rays. Without the sound bar the speakers are just too small and don't really cut it, even compared to just a sound bar and not the full 5.1 surround. I also wish this T.V. was capable of built in wifi with Netflix, alas it is not. I instead bought a Blu-Ray player and watch Netflix through that. But I knew this previous to purchasing it anyhow.I kind of wish I got the 60" however the price was much much higher, overall I love this T.V.GradesPicture Quality: A+Sound: B-Aesthetics: AEase of Use: B+Tweaking Ability: A+Inputs: C (needed a component and composite, not just one that is shared for both.)*Update* Keep in mind this model only has one input for composite/component. It actually shares both with the same input, not one of each. This kind of sucks, only because I have a lot of old video game consoles that are composite, so I have to use a switch. Which isn't a big deal.However now the component game systems I have won't work because the composite/component input is shared and there is only the one I am already using with the composite splitter. Otherwise I still love this TV and it still performs excellently.Overall: A

Reviews.Title: accountant from charlotte, nc.
Reviews.Author: B. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: the picture quality is so true to life that its makes everything look like soap opera filming because its just that clear and vivid.  colors pop! contrast is deep! and watching blu-ray content on it is absolutely breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: rf
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV and quality of HD is superb as well. I would highly recommend this TV for large Family or Living rooms.

Reviews.Title: This TV is very high quality. :D
Reviews.Author: Michael E. N. Andry
Reviews.Content: My parents bought this at Best Buy for $1,500 to replace an aging 32" Sanyo CRT. The installation was simple.PROS:-Although they're technically just stereo, the 2x15w speakers feel like multi-channel surround sound. They sound like my Bose Companion 2 Series II speakers. They have decent bass.-55" display.-LED panel makes the colors look richer.-The 120hz refresh rate looks more realistic and moves faster than 60hz.-Obvious, 1920x1080 resolution.-4 HDMI and 2 USB connectors, for devices like cameras and external hard drives.-Analog (3.5mm line-out) AND digital (TOSlink) audio outputs.CONS:-Composite is shared with component.-No S-video.OTHER:-This TV is very skinny, so wall mounting would be simple.-The power input is 2-prong with polarized power cord, not 3-prong grounded.-Ethernet connector for Internet apps. Also WiFi compatible(USB adapter not included).-AC 110-120 volts, 60 Hertz, 1.583-1.72 amps, 190 watts. Energy Star Compliant.-Made in Tijuana, Mexico with power cord made in China and remote made in Korea.-Surge protection recommended.-UL and FCC certified.If you're looking for a large display that's not 3D and you have many HDMI devices that you want to connect to your TV, buy this.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value for your dollar, sans S-Video
Reviews.Author: scir91
Reviews.Content: This TV is incredibly thin, produces incredible images, and is priced very well. There are two downsides to this unit: NO s-video input, and the speakers suck (you HAVE to get a sound system anyway to experience movie theater like quality). Other than that, it works well, very easy and simple to use, and looks beautiful whether on or off.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Dmitri
Reviews.Content: I got it use But its like new. I was looking for a long time for a good tv and i find it

Reviews.Title: I want more
Reviews.Author: Gmoney
Reviews.Content: The BEST picture that I have seen.  This TV is so great that I want to buy 2-3 more for each room.  I love it very much and it looks so sleek in its design.  It is easy to use and its just the right size for any room.  Maybe not the bathroom, unless your a freak. :).  Overall, for the price, it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Longtime Samsung Fan, not a home run
Reviews.Author: M. McFall "Yay interwebs"
Reviews.Content: I've owned many Samsung displays (LNR268W 26" LCD, LN46A550 46" LCD, UN46B6000 46" LCD, all still running, many many computer monitors) over the past 7 years and they have been one of the most consistent manufacturers of affordable high quality displays I have come across.  Unfortunately, this display somewhat bucked the trend.I'll keep this short and sweet since many of the other reviews have restated the issues.This is a beautifully designed display.  It is thin, it is light, it is incredibly affordable.  The picture quality is amazing and it has deeper blacks than my other Samsung displays; unlike my other Samsungs, the backlighting is not as uniform.  There is noticeable clouding on my set which can become apparent in dark or black scenes.  It is a bit distracting.  I've tried to tune this issue out by adjusting many of the numerous settings this TV has, but to no avail.  On that note, this set does have an impressive amount of granularity when it comes to fine tuning.  Very good color accuracy can be had.  Just stay away from the Dynamic setting which tends to blow everything out and cause details to be lost in the process.Amazon and the freight carrier that they hired to deliver my TV is top notch as usual.  The carrier called me ahead of time to schedule an appointment and called 20 minutes before they arrived, giving me ample time to prepare to take delivery.For those that don't care for 3D features and just want a good, large, inexpensive display, this is a very strong buy.

Reviews.Title: Simply awesome
Reviews.Author: Rush4141
Reviews.Content: Cant beat the picture and its is very stlyish. Saved $500 from the asking price at Best Buy and got free del what a sweet deal.

Reviews.Title: Video is crystal clear, much better than my Bravia 52" LED
Reviews.Author: Lance10 "Lance10"
Reviews.Content: Replaced my Samsung 46 inch LCD with this 55 inch. Picture on HD movies appears as though you're looking out a window versus an actual movie on screen. Vibrant for family room with alot of light with high bright ceilings.TV stand is much better than previous models where it felt a bit flimsy even though it was maybe more asthetically pleasing. This base is just a big rectangle and sturdy.DLNA plays well but there are issues with the Sony Google TV picture quality versus the Sony Bravia LED TV. While it's definitely HD quality, it's not as crisp as HD over the air or HD cable 1080p.Just my $.02,LT

Reviews.Title: 55" tv
Reviews.Author: John A. Purcell "navyblue kangaroo"
Reviews.Content: this is a wonder every time we use it,so clear and so very easy to use.We have now hooked the streaming features for netflix youtube etc and so we have the options to watch so many things  this is a super good deal as well

Reviews.Title: 55 inch Samsung led
Reviews.Author: art
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  The sound, however, like most other trim line cabinet models, is average at best.  Get an external sound source and you've got a terrific T.V.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Zack
