Reviews.Content: TV is gorgeous and very easy to use.  The entire setup is geared towards being hung on the wall.  The buttons on the front are hidden and the bezel is tiny.  Bought this for my parents (60's), and they love it.  This TV has one of the best pictures that I have seen anywhere.  Everyone that sees it just drops their jaw.  Wow!!!

Reviews.Title: An Overall Good TV
Reviews.Author: DeltaV
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace an aging DLP set that was way past its prime.  It arrived quickly from Amazon and it was well packaged.  The TV is thin and light for its size, which is the major selling point of this thin LED backlit LCD televisions.Wall mounting was painless and without any issues.  For those who do not wish to professionally calibrate the television, the automatic calibration and preset settings work well.  For anyone who doesn't like the presets, there are several websites out there that have posted professional calibration settings of this family (C6300-6500).  The colors are crisp and vibrant and in my opinion rival the plasma display that I was also considering at the time.  There is some motion blur in fast scenes, but adjusting the picture settings reduces this to the point that you can't really notice.  The television also works great in a brightly lit room because of its powerful LED backlighting.  The one negative with the picture--a negative that I frequently notice when viewing dark scenes--is that the edge mounted backlights cast some brightness around the corners.  This begins to get annoying, however it's price you have to pay if you want a television this thin and light.  LED backlit televisions that are not edge lit do not have this problem, however they are thicker and heavier.  If you watch television in a dark room and also watch a lot of programming that contains many dark scenes (such as many movies), then you might want to consider either a plasma or an LED backlit unit that has local dimming.  If the room that I have this TV set up in were not so bright I probably would have gone with a plasma.  If you want something light and thin, then this is your set as long as you can live with the edge lighting issue.I can't comment much about the sound quality from the speakers, as I have them hooked up to a surround sound system.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Ron from Florida
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with the TV. We were concerned that it would be too big for our room but it is not at all. We sit about 12 feet away but even sitting much closer would not be a problem.Did had a problem with the 2 screws that connect the TV to the stand. They stripped out or were stripped out from the start and almost cause the set to fall off the table. I replaced them with small bolts which are a lot safer.

Reviews.Title: No regrets!
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: Was looking for an upgrade for our 2 year old 1080p samsung. It wasn't a bad TV we just wanted bigger and to take advantage of LED. Also, we didn't want all the extra junk apps and other things. Top notch picture quality even with the blackest of pictures. It's consistent, colorful, and fast for gaming too! Absolutely perfect and I am very critical of my purchases.

Reviews.Title: A good upgrade over LCD
Reviews.Author: Andrew "ag89"
Reviews.Content: Price dropped twice shortly after we purchased the TV. Amazon price matched once but wouldn't a second, the price drop was $100 so we canceled the order and re-ordered at the new price. It was a round-about way of doing it but Amazon were helpful as usual and the process was easy, if a bit stupid because it would have cost amazon less to just match the price I assume. I bought this largely off reviews and the good price (1499) rather than doing any real research and I wasn't disappointed. The form factor is excellent, just a bit thicker than my blackberry, and the frame is unimposing and doesn't distract from the screen. The picture out of the box is impressive, needs a bit of adjustment to make the picture look 'real' but still very good. I can certainly tell the difference over my previous LCD TV (Toshiba Regza). The auto motion feature is hit and miss, sometimes it looks great and gives a 'live-tv' feel and sometimes it adversely affects the picture. You can adjust the options related to it but I often resort to just turning it off, and the picture looks ok anyway. A disappointment for me was the clouding/flashlighting in dark scenes, it it worse if viewed off-angle and not so bad from straight on. However I would still purchase this set knowing what I know. You can probably avoid this problem if you go for the 6800 model but this one is/was a bargain. I can plug my HDD into the USB port and play media files/videos/pictures directly using the Samsung media player whereas I used to hook up a laptop using HDMI. I really like this feature. Overall if you are looking for a TV with the usual Samsung quality, decent remote, good menu structure and numerous adjustments, along with an excellent picture, you shouldn't be disappointed. I was originally going to purchase a sound bar but the sound was good enough that I won't bother.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV.
Reviews.Author: John Robinson
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is brilliant, and we are very happy with our purchase.  The only time we notice any problem with the picture blurring with motion is watching animated movies, especially over Netflix streaming. The viewing angle is also suprisingly good (much better than our old rear projection TV). Otherwise, we have absolutely no complaints with the TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55C6300 LED Television
Reviews.Author: Hardware4you
Reviews.Content: All the televisions we purchase are Samsung because they are based on quality.  This television is no different.  Everything about this television is perfect.  From accurate measurements to operation of the remote, it has been though of.  The picture quality is breath taking, the sound coming from the speakers are plenty loud enough for a large room.  The ease of set up could not have been easier to follow.  Amazon used a third party shipping company and they did not take the television out of the box and put it on the wall.  They advised that they deliver to the room of your choice and leave it at that.  The shipping paperwork said they will set up television but not in this case.  Amazon now offers a price match on their website, well the price dropped $400. from purchase date 12 days after the sell.  We will see if Amazon honors that or gives me the run around.  Amazon has been very fair in the past and regardless of outcome, I will continue to do business with.  We attached our XBox 360 with Kinect and it worked perfectly.  It was amazing on such a large screen.  Please register your television on the Samsung website, they will extend your warranty by 3 months.  That gives you a total of 15 months instead of 12.  Well worth it.  One last thought.  The LED television is only 1 1/2 thick and weighs a little over 50 pounds.  It was very easy for two people to remove from box and mount on wall with existing brackets.

Reviews.Title: You want a gorgeous picture at a good price? This is it.
Reviews.Author: B. Thatner
Reviews.Content: Spectacular picture on this baby.  As with any tv, the settings out of the box are way too bright and edge enhanced, however, this unit gives you superb flexibility in how you can adjust the picture.  Menus are well labled and easy to find.  The only draw back of this unit is the sound.  I found the sound to be adequate but a little tinny and lacking in fidelity.  For such a large picture the sound just doesn't match.  But whatever the trade off in sound is, is more than made up for by the picture.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: James Tucker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based mainly o the feedback left by others and online reviews. It was the first time I have bought a TV from Amazon so I was a bit nervous about the whole prospect. The TV arrived damaged as the delivery was made by a single person. Amazon replaced the TV and stayed in contact with me during that process. I can't say enough good things about the customer service I received from Amazon.  The 2nd TV arrived perfectly and has the best picture quality of any TV I have ever owned. I combined it with the low profile wall mount and the unit looks like a work of art hanging on the wall. The only gripe I have for the TV is that the motion plus feature tended to blur digital content (I have all of my DVDs encoded onto a central hard drive in the house and use Apple TVs to play them).  Blue Ray DVDs look amazing on the TV, the speakers are good, but not jaw dropping.If you are looking for a good TV with amazingly clear picture, I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Wow....what a picture
Reviews.Author: Cranester
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture.  Pretty easy to install the stand to the TV.  There are more than enough HDMI connections but there needs to be more component and RCA connections.  Only one component and zero RCA connections!  Some of my equipment is older and does not even have HDMI connections.  Besides that...it is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG UN55C6300 55-INCH 1080P 120HZ LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Philip J. Manke "solarmanke"
Reviews.Content: GREAT PICTURE, DELAY IN CHANNEL SELECTING.This set found channels that my old (DLP) recever set did not. Selecting channels by number causes picture to drop out completely until set is turned off and on again. Weak signal causes picture dropout to blackscreen with little pixelation beforehand. It will not restore without manual changing channel and return.Sound quality is good with several (5) range settings. Haven't connected extra speakers yet.DVD's play well. Contrast is great for daytime viewing. Angle viewing is fine. Connections and mounting is linear.I am involved in solar and LED aps and was surprised the current draw was 200 watts. It was not listed in product specs. Amazon would do well to list this. Hint, hint!

Reviews.Title: Great with a few drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: MurphAC130
Reviews.Content: The TV is everything I've expected.  The only thing I've noticed is some "ghosting" from corners when watching in wide-screen mode.  It's fairly distracting and I'm thinking it could be just this tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, but you must purchase external speakers
Reviews.Author: Frances M. Nugent "puzzles"
Reviews.Content: Prior to puchasing this item, I read lots of reviews, almost all were excellent. I agree, this TV is great. I'm not a techy so I really don't know everything this TV can do. I don't play games but have connected my laptop and based on what I've done so far, its great. Unfort. the speakers really do "stink". You need to purchase other speakers, such as surround sound to really get the full benefit of this TV. The picture is excellent, my son in law, (who is a techy) loved the images and wanted to take the TV home with him. If you like a slim design, this is the one for you. I couldn't beleive how thin the set is. I have other LED TV's and one that's only a year old. This one blows it away.If your looking for a great TV, buy ths one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Carol Haney
Reviews.Content: Best TV we've ever had.  It is mounted above fireflace in a large den and can be enjoyed from every angle.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful in every way!!
Reviews.Author: Longtime Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We've been enjoying this TV for just over a month now.  Fast, efficient delivery by Amazon was superb, set up was simple, the picture quality is excellent and the look of the TV itself is beautiful.  We've added a Samsung soundbar which matches perfectly and really kicks up the movie-theater quality!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED-LCD TV 55''
Reviews.Author: Amazoner777 "amazoner777"
Reviews.Content: First impressions are good. Picture is clear and crisp. Sound is immaterial to me as I have Yamaha+Klipsch home theater system. Samsung apps are very few and UI needs improvement. Tried various media/apps/game consoles. Everthing works fine.

Reviews.Title: LED TV
Reviews.Author: Earlana Sims
Reviews.Content: I had seen other Samsung televisions and liked them very much.  This one does not disappoint.  The picture is sharp and bright.  The only minor problem is that my husband has a hearing problem and the sound does not adjust past a certain level.  We will probably add a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Anand V. Sampath
Reviews.Content: Picture is awesome. Great value at its price. Does have have the Internet ready stuff, but did not want that anyway. Lots of HDMI inputs as well as legacy connectors. Have already bought two, will buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Wonderful Price
Reviews.Author: AKadakia
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV is wonderful.  Installation was simple as well as setting up the TV.  the picture and sounds are amazing.  for the price, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful tv
Reviews.Author: TLPollock
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased, this is our second LED LCD from Samsung. Both have been perfect.Bright and clear picture.

Reviews.Title: another good product from amazon!
Reviews.Author: ANK2
Reviews.Content: I've purchased first 46" then I've decided to go with 55", amazon sent me the new one with out shipping fees because I wasn't happy with my old one!got the new one within 3 days...p.s. buy only products that are sold and shipped by AMAZON only! they really rock!

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Login
Reviews.Content: Good TV and a good deal which i got. Excellent sound and picture quality. Initially I thought of replacing this because there is no internet @ tv and samsung apps. Then I got a blu ray player which supports these features and I am njoying it. Really cool...

Reviews.Title: 55" Samsung LED Television
Reviews.Author: Steven W. Stuart
Reviews.Content: So far very happy with this TV.  Awesome picture and hooked a sound system up to it. It is like watching something in person almost. Would highly recommend this TV unless you are in to 3D.

Reviews.Title: Adjustment is  difficult
Reviews.Author: Drac
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit after EXTENSIVE research.  I considered ease of getting service, brand reputation, features, picture quality reviews and, of course, price.  I bought the TV on black Friday for an excellent price ($1499) from Amazon.  The unit shipped promptly and I was able to schedule delivery within a 2 hour window.  The set arrived a few minutes early.  I knew from my research that the delivery service included unboxing, assembly (installing the base), putting the TV on the stand I had for it, connecting it to power and a signal source (in my case a cable DVR) and making sure there was sound and picture.  However the person that brought it in (there were two men) asked me to sign for the TV without doing any of the above.  I asked about the additional service and he said "if you want us to do that you will have to initial some boxes on another paper".  I said, "no problem" and they proceeded doing all the installation steps I expected (no additional charge).The picture looks good, the TV has a LOT of adjustments (which is good and bad) and a lot of inputs. So far (three weeks) I am very pleased with the set.  I watch HD content from cable and have played some DVD's on a new Blu-ray unit I bought to go with the TV.  All input looks good  - even non-HD content seems sharper on this set.  My biggest negative issue with this TV, and why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 stars, is the difficulty in adjusting the picture to look good.  I assume this would be a problem with any TV of this quality level.  I have a 22 inch Vizio which I was able to adjust fairly easily (a day or two of adjusting the various settings).  In the three weeks I have had this Samsung TV I spend some time EVERY day trying to get the picture to look "right".  If I get it looking good for a movie, then a live show or taped show isn't exactly right.  Again, a good and bad is that there are 4 separate groups of settings for EACH input.  The problem is that one cannot copy/paste settings from one group within the 4 groups for each input nor to a group for another input.  So when I find a set of settings I like I have to make the same changes (and there are dozens of adjustable settings) on at least on group of each input.I believe I am getting close to what I think are optimum settings and eventually I think I will not be frequently adjusting the set.  I DID go online and found multiple forums that suggest settings that they arrived at either by their own trial and error or by using professional alignment devices.  But while these settings do get me in the ball park, and probably saved me time, they are not what I think are optimal for what I think looks good.The other negative is the black levels.  To get the screen to look really black, the brightness has to be turned down too far.  Fortunately I sit fairly far from the set (about 14 feet) so I can keep the brightness as high as needed without seeing the black become too grey.  But if I move within 4 feet of the set, the blacks are more grey (washed out).  I can also see (even far back) some grey near the lower right and left edges of the screen on SOME scenes when those areas are supposed to be black.  I think that is due to the edge lit LED, but maybe not.  The problem is not major and I usually do not notice it because it is limited to a small area near the edges.  I think most people would not notice or care, but if you are a perfectionist it could be irritating.I would recommend this TV to others.  I do not have Wi-Fi or internet access near the TV so I am not interested in using the set with online services.  Supposedly this set has the same picture quality as more expensive models in the 6000 series.  So if you want a great looking picture and do not want to pay for features internet based features you cannot use, this is a wonderful choice.  I was also looking at a 55 inch Vizio that has backlit (not edge lit) LED's. It had some good reviews but there were too many horror stories when people needed service.

Reviews.Title: Good looks, OK Picture Quality, Horrid viewing angle
Reviews.Author: up1bin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV during Black Friday weekend. Scheduling shipping was very easy, and the TV was delivered within the time frame promised (Pilot). I'd like to disclose upfront that I returned this TV to Amazon (see below).This is a great looking TV, very slim and light weight for having such a large screen.The Picture Quality leaves something to be desired, mainly with the colors (particularly skin tones) being "off" despite my best efforts at tweaking/calibrating numerous times. Also, the 120Hz Auto Motion Plus feature was nearly useless due to the excessive judder and image artifact issues (my wife also could not handle the "soap opera" look).My biggest issue, however, was the horrible viewing angle. Of course, I was not expecting plasma like performance on this TV and my living room setup is fairly typical (I have a L-sectional couch and a love seat on the other side, creating a "U" around the TV). Unless I was sitting directly in front of the TV, the colors and contrast would degrade almost immediately. I didn't buy a 55" TV so that only 1 person could enjoy the full picture quality at a time.Amazon was great in processing the return, and I purchased a Samsung plasma (PN58C550) as a replacement. Pilot delivered the new TV today and took back the UN55C6300 on the same trip.5 stars for Amazon customer service, 3 stars for the product.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: Rock
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all.  I got this from what was called uses "very good" condition. It come in a new box and appeared never to be used. I save about 600 bucks with free shipping and No TAX.. And the delivery guy waited for me to open it to make sure it was OK or he would have just took it away..  Was a good experience. And the TV is the best on the market for the money. The only one i seen that looked better were the higher model 7 and 8 series Samsungs..

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Rafael A Macias
Reviews.Content: The TV was easy to set up and the picture is amazing.  Every feature that I have tried has been great  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup + great picture = VERY HAPPY CAMPERS!
Reviews.Author: C. Hayman
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and we couldn't be happier.  The swivel is a very nice extra.  Hardly any wires in the back -- we even built a bookcase for it.  Samsung has made a great product.

Reviews.Title: An excellent set, I hope I can get used to it
Reviews.Author: J. McIntyre "phantom1584"
Reviews.Content: I picked this up 4 days ago.  I upgraded from a 46 inch samsung lcd (ln-t4665f).  Here's my thoughts thus far...I put this on a traditional tv stand, and installing the base was simple with the provided screws.  Just note that there are two sizes of screws, 5 each, and put the right screws in the right holes.The video quality over my last tv is amazing.  It is much more crisp and clear, with excellent colors.  Every shape was well defined.  With the size of the TV, it almost seemed like looking through a window at someone sitting right there.However one thing I wasn't prepared for was what an adjustment it would be for myself viewing wise going from a 3 year old 46 inch lcd to a modern day 55 inch lcd/led.  On the default settings, it did give me and my wife a feeling of motion sickness.  I'm viewing it from about 10-11 feet away.  I put in a blu-ray (wall-e), and it actually seemed too clear.  The movement of things just didn't seem natural.  This could have some to do with the 120Hz auto motion, which I did play with disabling, but it didn't fully remove the effect.  Picture looked very pretty, but just not what I was used to.  Its the same picture I'd seen in the store and it seemed fine there.  I think it might have been because the store was a more open viewing area that it didn't seem to bother me there.  I've been playing with the various settings, hoping that it will reduce our motion sickness feeling.  Time will tell on that.  I don't think this will cause me to return the unit, but I'll keep the box to play it safe.Overall, the set looks great on my corner tv stand.  Picture is amazing.  I don't notice any light bleed or color unevenness.  I just hope I can adjust to the size, or the motion differences, or whatever it is about this set that is causing me to feel a bit "off" while viewing.  I've been looking online for some calibration settings, but there isn't much out there yet for this particular model.

Reviews.Title: A Bit Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Surf City Bill
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching plasma vs. LED and came to the conclusion that you almost couldn't go wrong if you stayed with the market leaders....Samsung for LED, Pana for plasma.  So, I bought one of each for a family room and a master bedroom.  Both pictures are very good. However, the LED fell short in two regards.  Oftentimes the picture has a "soap-opera" quality to it.  Very noticeable while watching "Back to the Future".  I found that very distracting.  I thought I could get used to it. But after a month I couldn't.  The 2nd issue was more problematic.The stuttering or jittery picture which was very noticeable during "Terminator" made the movie difficult to watch.Also, I could never get a signal over 60hz even on the best HD channels.  I've read that the 120hz rating on this TV is a myth, however I have no way of proving that.  I had no issues with the audio but I never had it connected to a home theater system where I have also read a lip sync issue occurs on external devices.  Two more strikes against this TV.I will admit that for casual viewing (sitcoms, animation, nightly news) the picture is very, very good.Considering I've had zero issues with the plasma (which was less expensive by the way), I finally admitted my mistake and returned the Samsung for another Panasonic plasma.

Reviews.Title: Wow.
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Bright, vibrant, crisp picture. I have the Samsung 5 and 6 series from just a couple of years ago, and I cannot believe how thin they can make a 55" television. I have not put them side-by-side, but the LED seems brighter and just makes me smile to turn it on. Coupled with the Samsung slim wall mount, this thing is not even 2 inches off the wall. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Works as good as we hoped
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Benson "Outdoors Enjoy"
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  Makes you feel like you are on set while it's being filmed.  Very happy with the size and picture.  I was a little worried about spending this much money on line, but between the reviews and my experience with amazon I purchased online.  Saved several hundred dollars and I'm happy I did.

Reviews.Title: Borken in two months under very light use
Reviews.Author: David Z.
Reviews.Content: I am so mad with this product that I feel I have to write my first review on Amazon. I bought this TV on last Thanksgiving, just two month ago. This TV has been placed in my living home under very light use. I do not have cable service at home so most of the time it was only used for play some bluray and DVD disks. I probably only used this TV couple of hours each week in the past two months. I have to admit its picture quality is superb. But this can not justify its poor manufacturing quality. Tonight, after I turned on my TV for only several minutes, everything disappeared from the screen all of the sudden. I unplugged all the power wires and surge protector, and put them back on again. Still nothing was shown on the TV except a repeating clicking sound coming out from its back panel. As an engineer myself, I can tell clearly it is a failure of its power supply. I know Samsung's warranty should take care of the problem, but this is so annoying. It's broken in just two months! For a product with a high price tag, this is way too fast! Samsung's TV was built with such an incredibly low quality. I will never allow another Samsung TV into my home any more.

Reviews.Title: Nice - but PIP will not work on any Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Just bought Samsung 55" LED.  Great picture, easy to set up.  Bad surprise that PIP does not work.  You cannot watch two channels from your Cable Box.  You can watch a DVD, or some other source, which does zero good.This from the Samsung support site:Important: The information above, except for the Note, does not apply to Samsung LCD TVs that have PIP capability. Currently, all Samsung LCD TVs with PIP capability have a single tuner and are incapable of displaying two channels simultaneously, whether they are attached to a cable box or not.I think it's pretty misleading to say that you have PIP, and not tell us that it's essentially useless.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: L.E.O. 293
Reviews.Content: I purchased this t.v to replace a 57 inch projection HD t.v. This t.v is amazing and the price was better than anywhere else. This t.v is definitely an attention getter, when someone enters the room, especially if you deck it out with some surround sound sparkers. The picture quality is  fenominal with cable t.v.  Playing xbox360 or ps3 is unreal. When you decide to power up the blue ray player and watch a movie at 1080p, this t.v is rocking. In all applications this t.v is crisp, bright and all around awesome. L.e.d technology is definitely the way to go if you can afford it. Anyone considering a t.v in this price category should take this home. I currently have it on a glass table mount that I found online for cheap. I have no regrets after having the t.v for 30 days now and ordering it from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED
Reviews.Author: BDP1 "Brian"
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I decided on this TV. It was a great choice. The picture is crystal clear, the sound is much better than I expected, and the overall quality of the TV is superb. The only negative to this TV is that there is only one component input, the rest are HDMI. It would be much better if there was at least one more component input.The picture is amazing with blu-ray and HDTV, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing
Reviews.Author: J. Almeria
Reviews.Content: After several days of research, I decided to buy the 6300 in September.  The picture is simply amazing compared to my 5 year old 52" Mitsubishi dlp that died.  I figured it wasn't worth the extra the money for the apps because I already had a blu ray player that provided that. Nor did I care for 3d (yet).  I've had this tv for 4 months now and the picture is still awesome. True, some movies are so hi def that they look like soap operas but you get used to it.  Because of a couple negative reviews, I still have the box just in case I need to return it but so far so good. This tv is placed in a room with lots of windows and glare is not an issue with all of the windows open.  Due to its placement in the room, the only way to watch this tv is directly but I have not had any issues with the viewing angle.Considering free delivery, no taxes, and 36 months interest free financing, I decided to purchase this through Amazon.  I didn't have a positive experience with the delivery company (lots of miscommunication) but purchasing through Amazon was smooth and watching this Samsung tv is incredible. My only regret is not getting a 60 inch instead.

Reviews.Title: Built in Media Center
Reviews.Author: kayos592
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture. Built in media center was the icing on the cake. Simply plugged in a thumbdrive with a movie and bam.. bam bam!Very pleased...

Reviews.Title: Thin tv, quality issues.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Wilde "i believe in dog"
Reviews.Content: TV is very thin and light, hangs like a picture.  I did not have good luck with mine, it went bad after 10hrs.  20 or so vertical lines on the screen.  Also blurring when playing video games.  Amazon service is amazing, sending a new TV out.  I hope that it works as it is supposed to.  Will update review when the new TV arrives.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: I went from a Samsung DLP to the LED and it was a world of difference.  The people look real, the picture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Back light problem
Reviews.Author: snorsicgsn
Reviews.Content: This TV has a back light problem...in dark scenes you will notice puffs of white clouds as I call them in the back screen. No amount of adjustments will get rid of it, and I noticed others have noticed this problem with their TV as well. Stay away from this product at all costs. Samsung will not exchange your TV on the grounds that this is how the TV is. You'll be stuck with a TV with a manufacturer's flaw. They really dropped the ball on the LED. Stay with the LCD! But be aware of Samsung customer service they will rake over the coals! Terrible experience all around.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Dead Pixels
Reviews.Author: TheTVGuy
Reviews.Content: Having been a loyal customer of Sony TV's for years and witness the degrade of Sony quality in recent years, I thought it would be nice to change my preference once in a while by ordering a TV from a different manufacturer - Samsung. I've been researching into Samsung consumer electronics, especially TV's, and found general positive reviews on the performance and quality. So I went ahead and ordered a brand new Samsung LED TV 6300 model. The price tag without sale is over two grand, therefore, I expected to have top-notched performance and picture quality. However, into the second day of using it, I found two (02) adjacent dead pixels near the top left corner of the screen. They were so bright that they are visible even in the bright scenes of the broadcast programs. I called Amazon and scheduled a replacement immediately. One week later, a replacement came in. This time, I double checked carefully every aspect of the TV and found nothing...at least until the third day watching it: I have found another three (03) dead pixels, this time on different lines, right at the top left corner. I have no complaints whatsoever about the picture quality. In fact, I love the vibrant color and sharpness of the picture so much that I asked for the replacement of the very same model. But I am very disappointed in finding the dead pixels in both TV's. It is not acceptable to have that kind of defects in a product like that, much less in both of the TV's.

Reviews.Title: Never worked
Reviews.Author: disgusted
Reviews.Content: Recieved tv through modia,, from AMAZON,, what a nightmare,,bought as gift for sister,why amazon uses modia is beyond me,,company stinks,,this is the 4th tv i purchased from amazon,, no one from amazon has even called me about this problem..will never use amazon again.. thanks to MODIA

Reviews.Title: Power supply issue
Reviews.Author: TechGuy
Reviews.Content: I purchased UN55c6300SF a little less than 6 months and the power supply needed to be replace.1 week to order part !

Reviews.Title: no headphone jack!
Reviews.Author: M. Luu
Reviews.Content: all 2010 samsung led tv lost the headphone jack. that means if you connect a headphone or pc speakers into the analog audio out, you will lose auto volume and volume control. i am so pissed about this, i am about to pull my hair out. i am absolutely disappointed.
